para.text: The owner of a vehicle in a class eligible for registration plates consisting of letters, numbers, emblems, terms, symbols, logos, or a combination of them may apply for a special registration plate from the Administration.
This chapter applies to all registration plates issued under COMAR 11.15.07 and 11.15.19 regardless of the date of issuance.

section.heading: Refusal to Issue Registration Plates.
section.text: The Administration may refuse to issue or rescind issuance of a registration plate containing letters, numbers, emblems, terms, symbols, logos, or a combination of them which:

para.text: Is identical to one already issued by the Administration;
Is being requested for a fraudulent or deceptive purpose;
Has a scatological or sexual meaning or connotation;
Communicates a message of any kind about any of the following characteristics of a group of people:
Makes reference to the commission of illegal acts; or
Contains any other combination that the Administrator finds unacceptable within the law.

section.heading: Compliance.
section.text: The Administration shall determine compliance with the conditions set forth in Regulation .02 of this chapter by reference to current and historical usage.

section.heading: Complaints.
section.text: A complaint that a plate violates the conditions of Regulation .02 of this chapter may cause the Administration to review the matter, but may not by itself serve as a basis for a determination that the conditions of Regulation .02 of this chapter have been violated.

section.heading: Administrative Appeals.
section.text: An organization or individual whose preferred letters, numbers, emblems, terms, symbols, logos, or a combination of them are disapproved by the Administration under this chapter is entitled to a hearing before the Office of Administrative Hearings pursuant to the Administrative Procedures Act.

annotations.annotation: Transportation Article, §§12-104(b) and 13-619, Annotated Code of Maryland
Regulation .01 amended as an emergency provision effective August 12, 2015 (42:18 Md. R. 1173); amended permanently effective November 23, 2015 (42:23 Md. R. 1434)
